content.title: Scheme of Scholarship for Sainik Schools
content.department: Directorate Of Higher and Technical Education
content.details: Scheme Of Scholarship For Sainik Schools was launched by the Directorate Of Higher and Technical Education, Meghalaya, to prepare young boys for a career in the Cadre of the Armed Forces. The scholarships are awarded to students whose parents are permanent residents of Meghalaya and whose family income is less than ₹8,000/- per month.
benefits: Scholarship of ₹20,000/-, awarded to the students whose family income is below ₹5,000/- per month.
Scholarship of ₹10,000/-, awarded to the students whose family income is between ₹5,000/- to ₹8,000/- per month.
eligibility: The applicant should be a student of the Sainik School, Goalpara.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST)/ Scheduled Caste (SC), or the applicant should be a child of Service Personnel (including the ex-servicemen community).
The student should be studying in class 12th.
The student should be fluent in the English language.
The parents of the student should be permanent residents of Meghalaya.
The student's family income should be less than ₹8,000/- per month.
content.application_process: Offline. The applicant should visit the Office of the Principal, Sainik School Goalpara, and request a hard copy of the application form. Fill in all mandatory fields and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the application form along with the documents to the Principal, Sainik School, Goalpara, Assam.
documents_required: Copy of Student’s Previous Year’s Mark Sheet.
Copy of Admission Receipt of Sainik School.

faqs.question: Can students use the scholarship amount for any educational-related expenses?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can use the scholarship amount to cover various educational expenses, including tuition fees, books, stationery, and other academic necessities.

faqs.question: Is the scholarship amount a one-time payment or provided on a recurring basis?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount is provided as a one-time payment to eligible students based on their family income category.

faqs.question: How is the scholarship amount disbursed to eligible students?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount is typically disbursed directly to the student to support their educational expenses.

faqs.question: What is the scholarship amount awarded under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount varies based on the family income of the student. Students with a family income below ₹5,000/- per month receive ₹20,000/-, while those with a family income between ₹5,000/- to ₹8,000/- per month receive ₹10,000/-.

faqs.question: Can students from families with income slightly above ₹8,000/- per month apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, students from families with income exceeding ₹8,000/- per month are not eligible to apply for the scholarship.

faqs.question: Can students from other states apply if their parents are not permanent residents of Meghalaya?
faqs.answer: No, only students whose parents are permanent residents of Meghalaya are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions for applicants?
faqs.answer: While there are no specific age restrictions mentioned, applicants must be studying in class 12th at Sainik School, Goalpara, at the time of application.

faqs.question: Can students with disabilities apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, students with disabilities who meet the eligibility criteria are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

faqs.question: Are there any gender-based restrictions for applicants?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines do not mention any gender-based restrictions for applicants.

faqs.question: Can students from any academic background apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, students from any academic background studying in class 12th at Sainik School, Goalpara, are eligible to apply for the scholarship.
